member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.BlobTriggerAttribute
member.summary: Represents an attribute that binds a parameter to an Azure Blob, causing the method to run when a blob is uploaded.
member.remarks:
The method parameter type can be one of the following:
ICloudBlob
CloudBlockBlob
CloudPageBlob
A custom type implementing

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.BlobTriggerAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The path of the blob to which to bind.
member.remarks: The blob portion of the path can contain tokens in curly braces to indicate a pattern to match. The matched name can be used in other binding attributes to define the output name of a Job function.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.BlobTriggerAttribute.BlobPath
member.summary: Gets the path of the blob to which to bind.
member.remarks: The blob portion of the path can contain tokens in curly braces to indicate a pattern to match. The matched name can be used in other binding attributes to define the output name of a Job function.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.BlobAttribute

The method parameter type can be one of the following:
ICloudBlob
CloudBlockBlob
CloudPageBlob
(read-only)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TableAttribute
member.summary: Represents an attribute that binds a parameter to an Azure Table or Table entity.
member.remarks:
When only the table name is provided, the attribute binds to a table, and the method parameter type can be one of the following:
CloudTable
(where T implements ITableEntity)
When the table name, partition key, and row key are provided, the attribute binds to a table entity, and the method parameter type can be one of the following:
ITableEntity
A user-defined type not implementing ITableEntity (serialized as strings for simple types and JSON for complex types)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TableAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The name of the table to which to bind.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TableAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The name of the table containing the entity.
The partition key of the entity.
The row key of the entity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TableAttribute.TableName
member.summary: Gets the name of the table to which to bind.
member.remarks: When binding to a table entity, gets the name of the table containing the entity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TableAttribute.PartitionKey
member.summary: When binding to a table entity, gets the partition key of the entity.
member.remarks: When binding to an entire table, returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TableAttribute.RowKey
member.summary: When binding to a table entity, gets the row key of the entity.
member.remarks: When binding to an entire table, returns .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.NoAutomaticTriggerAttribute
member.summary: Represents an attribute that indicates a function for which no automatic trigger listening is performed.
member.remarks:
This attribute is useful in two cases:
Functions with triggers Prevents automatic invocation of the triggers, allowing manual polling.
Functions without other attributes Flags the function as an available job function.
In both cases, functions marked with this attribute are never called automatically by JobHost (during RunAndBlock). Instead, they must be invoked manually using the Call method.
